parameters.definition: Minimum units of vitamin A needed
Minimum units of vitamin C needed
Units of vitamin A in a crab cake
Units of vitamin C in a crab cake
Units of vitamin A in a lobster roll
Units of vitamin C in a lobster roll
Maximum fraction of meals that can be lobster rolls
Units of unsaturated fat in a crab cake
Units of unsaturated fat in a lobster roll

description: A sailor can eat either crab cakes or lobster rolls for his meals. He needs to ensure he gets at least \param{VitaminAmin} units of vitamin A and at least \param{VitaminCmin} units of vitamin C. Each crab cake contains \param{VitaminAcrab} units of vitamin A and \param{VitaminCcrab} units of vitamin C. Each lobster roll contains \param{VitaminAlobster} units of vitamin A and \param{VitaminClobster} units of vitamin C. In addition, since lobster is more expensive, at most \param{LobsterFractionMax} of his meals should be lobster rolls. If each crab cake contains \param{FatCrab} units of unsaturated fat and each lobster roll contains \param{FatLobster} units of unsaturated fat, how many of each should he eat to minimize his unsaturated fat intake?
